alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 11:59PM EDT until August 13 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Lancaster County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1159 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Robesonia to Kleinfeltersville to Manheim, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ephrata, New Holland, Akron, Denver, Reamstown, Rothsville, Adamstown, Brickerville, Terre Hill, Churchtown, Bareville and Bowmansville. This includes The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 270 to 295. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Stay inside a well built structure and keep away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these severe thunderstorms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
